data.title: Hatter's castle by CRONIN, A[rchibald] J[oseph]: (1931) FIRST EDITION.
data.meta_description: FIRST EDITION. - Victor Gollancz Ltd, London - 1931 - Black publisher's cloth, gilt lettering to spine, in original dust-jacket. HIS FIRST NOVEL. First edition of Cronin's first novel, the story of an arrogant and cruel hat-maker who struggles for social acceptance. It was made into a motion picture in 1942, starring Robert Newton, Deborah Kerr and James Mason. The Scottish born Cronin (1896-1981) earned his M.D. from the University of Glasgow. After a few years, he gave up practice due to the unexpected success of this, his first book Hatter's castle, which enabled him to write full time. - Hatter's castle
data.text:
About this Item

Black publisher's cloth, gilt lettering to spine, in original dust-jacket. HIS FIRST NOVEL. First edition of Cronin's first novel, the story of an arrogant and cruel hat-maker who struggles for social acceptance. It was made into a motion picture in 1942, starring Robert Newton, Deborah Kerr and James Mason. The Scottish born Cronin (1896-1981) earned his M.D. from the University of Glasgow. After a few years, he gave up practice due to the unexpected success of this, his first book Hatter's castle, which enabled him to write full time. Seller Inventory # 12093

Contact seller

Report this item

Niceya Corp., a California corporation, doing business as B & L Rootenberg Rare Books & Manuscripts, member of the ABAA, ILAB, and ABA, was founded in 1970 is an internationally renowned antiquarian bookseller. We are among the leading specialists in the fields of science, medicine, technology and natural history. We also maintain high quality rare books and manuscripts in all diverse subjects. To order, please telephone, fax or e-mail.

Terms of Sale:

All items offered are subject to prior sale. Items are unconditionally guaranteed

as described, and may be returned within ten days of receipt with prior notice.

Prices set forth are net and subject to change. Payments may be made by check,

bank/wire transfer or bank draft, payable in U.S. dollars drawn on a U.S. bank. We

also accept AMERICAN EXPRESS. Other major credit cards are handled through Abe at

a higher percentage.

Shipping Terms:

Shipping cost estimates made by Abebooks are based on weights of 2.2 lbs, or 1 kg, and a standard posting by the USPS. Excess weight, use of alternate shippers, additional postage, and insurance charges will be added to your order. Appropriate sales tax for California residents will also be added. We will contact you with these amounts.
